intro: Strobilanthes subcapitata, commonly known as the "Cape York strobilanthes," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are usually brightly colored, with a distinctive two-lipped structure, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Strobilanthes subcapitata is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and unique floral morphology.
